tuv.seg: Legal options following marital breakdown
Torthaí ar Scaradh nó Colscaradh
When a marriage first breaks up, many couples informally separate and live apart
Nuair a theipeann ar phósadh ar dtús, is iondúil go scarann lanúin agus go gcónaíonn siad ó chéile
Marital breakdown affects all areas of a person' s life, and most people go on to regulate matters between them in a legal context
Bíonn tionchar ar bhriseadh an phósta ar chuile ghné de shaol an duine agus téann an chuid is mó daoine ar aghaidh le rudaí a shocrú eatarthu go dleathúil
There are three different ways of doing this in Ireland:
Tá trí bhealach ann len é seo a dhéanamh in Éirinn:
A separation agreement is reached through agreement between the parties, whereas a court grants a judicial separation or a divorce
Tagann an lanúin iad féin chuig na socruithe a bhaineann le socrú scartha, ach bíonn socrú cúirte i gceist le scaradh dleathúil agus colscaradh
Of these, only a decree of divorce dissolves the marriage and allows each party to remarry
Colscaradh amháin a chuireann deireadh leis an bpósadh agus a fhágann an bheirt saor le hathphósadh
In specific circumstances, a court can grant a nullity decree
I gcúinsí faoi leith, is féidir le cúirt ordú neamhní a cheadú
The effect of a nullity decree is that the court determines that no marriage ever existed
Sa chás seo tá an chúirt ag rá nach raibh aon phósadh ann ariamh
The law in relation to nullity is complex, and you should always seek legal advice to assess whether the circumstances exist for a nullity application
Tá an dlí a bhaineann le pósadh a chur ar neamhní fíorchasta, agus ní mór comhairle dlí a fháil i gcónaí le cinneadh a dhéanamh an bhfuil cás ann iarratas ar an bpósadh a chur ar neamhní a dhéanamh
A Roman Catholic church annulment has no legal effect
Níl aon stádas dleathúil ag ordú ón Eaglais Chaitliceach pósadh a chur ar neamhní
